DataElement.preferredName: Diagnostic Imaging Magnetic Resonance Imaging Endoscopic Ultrasound Performed Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the date of a magnetic resonance imaging,  imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide amazingly clear and detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues, or endoscopic ultrasound, an ultrasound administered by using a tube containing flexible fibre optic wires that allows for the analysis of tissues inside the body, being performed as a method diagnostic evaluation.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Diagnostic Imaging Magnetic Resonance Imaging Endoscopic Ultrasound Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to magnetic resonance imaging,  imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide amazingly clear and detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues, or endoscopic ultrasound, an ultrasound administered by using a tube containing flexible fibre optic wires that allows for the analysis of tissues inside the body, being performed as a method diagnostic evaluation.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues for diagnostic evaluation..

Concepts.definition: Any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues for diagnostic evaluation.

Property.preferredName: Magnetic Resonance Imaging Endoscopic Ultrasound Performed
Property.preferredDefinition: Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide amazingly clear and detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders. :An ultrasound administered by using a tube containing flexible fibre optic wires that allows for the analysis of tissues inside the body.  Ultrasound technology utilizes high frequency waves and their echoes to produce an image. 2005:Performed; carried out.

Concepts.definition: Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders.

An ultrasound administered by using a tube containing flexible fibre optic wires that allows for the analysis of tissues inside the body.  Ultrasound technology utilizes high frequency waves and their echoes to produce an image. 2005
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The date on which an observation was made or an event occurred.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/3/17 tt added Diagnosis CSI. 6/20/17 jk transferred to NCI Standards per confirmation by Brian Campbell as part of Round 5 finalization task, added reg status.

DataElement.origin: ACOSOG CRF:American College of Surgeons Oncology Group Case Report Form
